content: Yun Zhang is a Ph.D. student in Data Science and Analytics (DSA) at the Guangzhou Campus of The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST), supervised by Professor Bingyi Jing. He received his Master’s degree from the University of Hong Kong (HKU) in 2021, and his Bachelor’s degree from Southern University of Science and Technology (SUSTech) in 2020. His research interests include but not limited to machine learning, computational statistics and data visualization.
summary: Yun Zhang is a Ph.D. student in Data Science and Analytics (DSA) at the Guangzhou Campus of The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST), supervised by Professor Bingyi Jing.
title: Yun Zhang

content:
I am currently learning some basic concepts related to Graph Neural Networks (GNN) and representation learning.
 Node2Vec: simulations of biased random walks I use this open-source node2vec implementation to simulate biased random walks in the node2vec algorithm. Following two videos illustrate the in-out parameter $q$’s role played in random walks with fixed return parameter $p$, i.e. a “ratio” of BFS vs. DFS.
  High in-out parameter $q$, Micro-view of neighbourhood, BFS 
  Low in-out parameter $q$, Macro-view of neighbourhood, DFS
title: Graph Neural Networks
